multiple_choice.choice: Transport oxygen and carbon dioxide in the blood
Exchange oxygen and carbon dioxide with the environment

response.feedback: Incorrect. the respiratory system does not transport the gasses, that is the role of the cardiovascular system.
Correct. When we breath we move air and respiratory gasses in and out of our lungs.

part.hint: The respiratory system uses pulmonary ventilation or breathing to accomplish this role.

question.body: If there was an obstruction in the trachea, which of the following would you expect?

multiple_choice.choice: a decrease in blood carbon dioxide levels
an increase in blood carbon dioxide levels
a decrease in blood oxygen levels
both, a decrease in blood carbon dioxide levels and a decrease in blood oxygen levels
both an increase in blood carbon dioxide levels and a decrease in blood oxygen levels

response.feedback: Incorrect. If the trachea is blocked carbon dioxide cannot leave the lungs and will accumulate in the blood.
Incorrect. If the trachea is blocked carbon dioxide will accumulate becasue it cannot leave but what else?
Incorrect. Incorrect. If the trachea is blocked, oxygen (air) cannot enter the lungs and will not pass into the blood but what else will occur?
Incorrect. Remember carbon dioxide and oxygen move in opposite directions.
Correct. If there is an obstruction in the trachea air and the oxygen in it cannot enter the lungs nor leave to eliminate carbon dioxide.

part.hint: Think about the direction oxgyen and carbon dioxide move when we breath.
If the trachea is blocked, can air get in or out of the lungs?
